p: Although a warmer winter may be “mortality protective”, extreme cold presents a risk of acute myocardial infarctions [ 50] and increased mortality for people with COPD [ 20]. Additionally, warming winters have led to falling-through-the-ice events with drownings [ 51]. Despite limited research on mortality related to prolong periods of extreme cold and hypothermia [ 37, 45, 46], given the extreme cold events in the southern U.S. during the winter of 2021 with subsequent mortality, this is an area that needs further investigation.
